title.narrative: OPT 3.2. ACCESS TO A CHILD FRIENDLY JUSTICE & CP SERVICES

description.narrative: Children and adolescents in four departments (La Paz, Santa Cruz, Cochabamba and Pando) and selected municipalities with UNICEF support have increased access to a child friendly justice system and specialized child protection services aligned with the national legal framework., which contributes to Access To Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents victims of violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation are protected by functioning systems, policies and a national legal frameork aligned with international standards, including in emergency situations.

related-activity.ref: 0510/A0/05/403 OCM 3. EVERY CHILD IS PROTECTED FROM VIOLENCE AND EXPLOITATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and adolescents in four departments (La Paz, Santa Cruz, Cochabamba and Pando) and selected municipalities with UNICEFsupport have increased access to a child friendly justice system and specialized child protection services aligned with thenational legal framework.

description.narrative: In total,514.501 children and adolescents(251,728 girls, 262,773 boys) from 196 municipalities, accessed better protection services in 2021.10.000 protection system workersdeveloped their skills and knowledge through training, technical assistance and supply delivery ensuring children, adolescents and their families received more efficient and sensitive attention that was adapted to their needs. Specifically,10.556 childrenin vulnerable situations received direct support from UNICEF, contributing to the fulfilment of their rights and better access to services. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2021
